questions.question: What is the primary responsibility of a Security Analyst?
options: B. Monitoring and analyzing security threats

questions.question: Which of the following is a common tool used by Security Analysts for intrusion detection?
What does SIEM stand for?
options: A. Security Information and Event Management
B. System Integration and Event Monitoring
C. Secure Internet and Email Management
D. Security Incident and Event Monitoring

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a type of malware?
What is the purpose of a firewall in cybersecurity?
options: A. To filter and monitor incoming and outgoing network traffic
B. To detect and remove malware from a system
D. To analyze suspicious files for vulnerabilities

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a social engineering attack?
What is the primary goal of penetration testing?
options: B. To evaluate security defenses by simulating attacks
C. To identify system usability issues

questions.question: Which protocol is commonly used to encrypt web traffic?
Which of the following is a key principle of the CIA triad?
What does an IDS (Intrusion Detection System) do?
options: B. Detects and alerts on suspicious activity

questions.question: What is the main difference between IDS and IPS?
options: A. IDS blocks traffic, while IPS only monitors it
B. IDS only detects threats, while IPS can take action to prevent them
C. IDS works offline, while IPS requires an internet connection
D. IDS is software-based, while IPS is hardware-based

questions.question: Which of the following is a common encryption algorithm?
What is the primary function of a VPN?
options: B. To create a secure encrypted connection over a public network

questions.question: What is a zero-day vulnerability?
options: A. A vulnerability that has been known for years
B. A security flaw that is unknown to the vendor and has no available fix
C. A cyberattack that lasts for a single day
D. A virus that spreads in a single day

questions.question: Which attack involves intercepting and altering communication between two parties?
Which regulation focuses on data protection and privacy for individuals in the European Union?
What type of attack exploits vulnerabilities in web applications to inject malicious SQL statements?
What is the purpose of multi-factor authentication (MFA)?
options: B. To add an extra layer of security by requiring multiple forms of verification

questions.question: Which of the following is an open-source security tool used for penetration testing?
What is the main objective of an incident response plan?
options: B. To provide a structured approach for handling security incidents
